snippet: Two fantasy companies defended their businesses’ integrity after accusations that employees were placing bets at rival sites using information not available to the public.
abstract: Major scandal has surfaced in multibillion-dollar fantasy sports industry, with allegations of insider trading after employee at DraftKings wins $350,000 dollars on bet placed with rival site FanDuel; incident raises questions about employee access to data, how it is protected, and whether industry needs to develop procedures for policing itself.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and JACQUELINE WILLIAMS

lead_paragraph: Two fantasy companies defended their businesses’ integrity after accusations that employees were placing bets at rival sites using information not available to the public.

headline.main: Scandal Erupts in Unregulated World of Fantasy Sports
headline.print_headline: Scandal in Unchecked World of Fantasy Sports
